revised_title: Investigating the Diurnal Range of Magnetic Declination at Trevandrum Observatory
tldr: This article discusses the diurnal range of magnetic declination at the Trevandrum Observatory, comparing the results with those from the Kew Observatory. The author finds that the annual variation of the declination range at Trevandrum has two minima and two maxima, with the character of the diurnal variation changing around the equinoxes. The author also investigates the long-period variation and planetary periods, finding similarities with the Kew observations.
